result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant BJ Dolan appeared by phone, in custody at DCI.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for BJ Dolan.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of the information.  Not guilty plea entered to all counts.  Court will permit video appearance for the defendant if resolves at jury status hearing.  Court will issue a pretrial order.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Confirmed telephone appearance with DCI for 9-19-2022 at 8:30 a.m. and counsel confirmed.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant BJ Dolan appeared by video, in custody from DCI.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for BJ Dolan.  Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Defendant requests to appear by video for the next hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on September 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant BJ Dolan in court, in custody.  (21CF276; 21CF363 Br. 4; Waukesha Co. 21CF525)  Defendant requests court appointed attorney. Court appoints Atty Becky Van Dam. State objects to any bond change.  Court denies bond modification.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant BJ Dolan in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in court for BJ Dolan.  (21CF276 Br. 4; 21CF363 Br. 4; Waukesha Co. 21CF525)  Atty. Borkowicz states the Branch 4 cases Motion to Withdraw has been denied.  State advises believes the SPD office would appoint a 3rd attorney but becomes an issue with having different attorneys on cases.  Defendant requests Atty. Borkowicz withdraw and will argue Bail Motion on own.  Court grants Atty. Borkowicz's Motion to Withdraw.  Defendant makes argument on Bail Motion and request $750.00 cash bond.  State opposes any bail modification.  Additional statements by defendant.  Court denies the bond motion and maintains current bond.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription. Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant refused to sign.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant BJ Dolan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for BJ Dolan. Def consents to appearing by video.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. SPD to appoint.  Def has other Washington Co cases and Wauk Co cases pending.  Court sets $10,000 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
